Posts.Content: Dukip wrote: Hi all, I have been a member for a while, but I think this is my first post.  I had wide local excision (lumpectomy) in October 2014, then axillary clearance in November 2014 followed by FEC-T chemo and radiotherapy along with 5 days of boost. I developed lymphoedema in right (affected) breast straight away during radiotherapy, but in November last year my left armpit started hurting, I have been to GP (primary care in UK) twice, she referred me back to the breast surgeon who said there is no sign of recurrence - but gave me no explanation of why the pain was there. Does anybody have any experience of this or any ideas what it could be?  I am back to GP tomorrow to see what next. Thank you all who reply. Dx 9/25/2014, IDC, Right, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 3/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pain in opposite armpit Dukip Dukip

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2016 12:08PM Dukip wrote: I thought I had a reply!  But not so . . . .
Posts.Title: Pain in opposite armpit Dukip Dukip
